description.shacl: Shacl is a language for validating RDF graphs against a set of conditions.

sidebar_menu_account.basic_info: This is your basic information that will be shown throughout the application

export_annotations_validations_sidebar.download_description: Download the annotations of the selected dataset.
export_annotations_validations_sidebar.export_description: Export the annotations of the selected dataset.

serialization.label: Serialization
serialization.description: Select the serialization format of your export

include.label: Include
include.description: Select the elements you want to include in your export
include.creator: Include creator

archive.label: Archive Format
archive.description: Select the archive format of your export

export_annotations_validations_sidebar.link_copied: Annotations export link copied to clipboard
export_annotations_validations_sidebar.error: There was an error while exporting the annotations.

new_annotator_sidebar.description: Annotators allow linking a dataset's elements with other knowledge base resources.

annotator.label: Annotator
annotator.description: The predefined annotator that will be used.
annotator.notify_text: AIDA/Rubik Annotator is ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore.

annotator_type.label: Annotator Type
annotator_type.description: Obsolete. To be replaced by tags.

variant.label: Variant
variant.description: The execution mode. Serial execution means iterating over all relevant items, while grouped execution means first grouping identical elements and iterating only over them.

default_target.label: Default Target Property
default_target.description: A property for automatically exporting annotations. It determines the default property that links the annotations to the original data elements.

function.label: Function/Boolean operations
function.notify_text: Preprocessing allows manipulation and/or filtering of values before being passed to the annotator

error.creating: There was an error while creating the annotator.
error.updating: There was an error while updating the annotator.

new_filter_validation_sidebar.title: New Filter Validation
new_filter_validation_sidebar.description: A filter validation allow mass rejection of specific automatically produced annotations, or their replacement by other values.

name.label: Name
name.description: A name for the filter validation

success.creating: The filter validation was successfully created.
success.updating: The filter validation was successfully updated.

error.creating: There was an error while creating the filter validation.
error.updating: There was an error while updating the filter validation.

new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.dataset_description: A dataset is a collection of organized and structured data, you can import and enrich your data using enrichment app.
new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.catalog_description: A catalog is a collection of dataset, you can import and enrich your data using enrichment app.
new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.dataset_type_description: The type of the dataset. Collections are general purpose datasets, vocabularies represent ontologies or thesauri (e.g. a SKOS thesaurus), and alignments represent equivalence relations between other dataset elements.
new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.identifier_description: A dataset identifier that will be used in the generation of easy to remember URIs for accessing the dataset.
new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.identifier_error_invalid: The identifier that you provided is not valid
new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.identifier_error_exists: The identifier that you provided already exists
new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.visibility_description: The visibility of the dataset. Public datasets can be accessed through automatically generated public APIs (e.g. SPARQL endpoints).
new_dataset_catalog_sidebar.location_description: The location of the dataset. Local datasets can be populated with content and can be published and unpublished in a SAGE managed triplestore. Remote datasets are read-only datasets accessible through remote SPARQL endpoints.

new_campaign_sidebar.campaign_description: A campaign is a set of annotated datasets for which you can ask users to validate the annotations.
new_campaign_sidebar.name: Name
new_campaign_sidebar.state_description: The state of the campaign. Validation is allowed while the campaign is running. A campaign can be stopped and resumed.

new_project_sidebar.project_description: A project is a way of grouping resources together.
new_project_sidebar.name: Name
new_project_sidebar.identifier_description: A project identifier that will be used in the generation of easy to remember URIs for accessing the project.

join_project_sidebar.project_description: The project that you will join.
join_project_sidebar.project_not_selected: You have not selected a project.

new_scheme_sidebar.d2rml_description: D2RML is a data transformation language for transforming and combining diverse data into custom RDF datasets.
new_scheme_sidebar.shacl_description: Shacl is a language for validating RDF graphs against a set of conditions.
new_scheme_sidebar.name: Name
new_scheme_sidebar.identifier_description: An identifier that will be used in the generation of easy to remember URIs for accessing the scheme.

join_campaign_sidebar.join_campaign_description: Select the campaigns you want to join from the list

add_datasets_sidebar.description: Select datasets from the list to add to your

add_datasets_sidebar.success_remove_toast: You have removed the dataset from the

add_users_sidebar.title: Add Users to Campaign
add_users_sidebar.description: Select users from the list to add to your campaign

add_users_sidebar.success_add_toast: You have added the user to the campaign.
add_users_sidebar.success_remove_toast: You have removed the user from the campaign

add_mapping_sidebar.description: Mappings allow generation of RDF content from multiple data sources and data formats.
add_mapping_sidebar.identifier_description: A mapping identifier that will be used in the generation of easy to remember URIs for accessing the dataset.
add_mapping_sidebar.mapping_type_description: The type of the mapping. A metadata mapping generates metadata for the dataset. A data mapping generates actual content.
add_mapping_sidebar.mapping_source_description: Create a blank mapping and then manually edit it by writing your specifications in the D2RML language (a variation of RML) [provide link], upload an already existing mapping file expressed in D2RML or select one of the  predefined mappings.
add_mapping_sidebar.d2rml_document_description: An existing D2RML document that maps data to RDF.
add_mapping_sidebar.sample_mapping_description: Predefined mappings allow easy generation of content from specific sources.
add_mapping_sidebar.parameters_description: This mapping requires some input parameters from the user. You will have to provide them later on, when creating an instance of that mapping.

add_mapping_instance_sidebar.title: Create Mapping Instance
add_mapping_instance_sidebar.description: Fill in the parameters below to create a new instance for mapping {name}.
add_mapping_instance_sidebar.identifier_description: A mapping instance identifier that will be used in the generation of easy to remember URIs for accessing the dataset.

success.creating: The mapping instance was successfully created.
success.updating: The mapping instance was successfully updated.

error.creating: There was an error while creating the mapping instance.
error.updating: There was an error while updating the mapping instance.

add_rdf_sidebar.description: RDF data files allow directly adding content already available in an RDF serialization.
add_rdf_sidebar.error_name_required: You need to provide a name
add_rdf_sidebar.error_file_required: You need to upload an RDF data file
add_rdf_sidebar.error_post_new_rdf: There was an error while saving the RDF data file
add_rdf_sidebar.success_post_new_rdf: The RDF data file was successfully uploaded

add_index_sidebar.title: New Index
add_index_sidebar.description: Indices offer fast search access to a dataset's content.
add_index_sidebar.name: Name
add_index_sidebar.identifier_description: A dataset identifier that will be used in the generation of easy to remember URIs for accessing the dataset.
add_index_sidebar.visibility_description: The visibility of the index. Public datasets can be accessed through automatically generated public APIs (e.g. SPARQL endpoints).

attach_source_data_file_sidebar.title: New Source Data File
attach_source_data_file_sidebar.description: Source data files are local files that provide data to a mapping.

source_data_file.label: Source Data File
source_data_file.error: You need to upload a source data file

attach_source_data_file_sidebar.success_creating: The source data file was successfully attached.
attach_source_data_file_sidebar.error_creating: Something went wrong during the upload. Please try again.

add_user_task_sidebar.description: User tasks allow batch execution and scheduling of tasks.

add_user_task_sidebar.cron_description: Specify how often you want your selected tasks to be executed.

item_sorting_order.label: Item Sorting Order

vocabularies.description: The vocabularies that will be used for the validation
